content: The app uses dark patterns to get users to buy more apps. On the home screen it pops up a "more apps" button that inevitably grabs the child's attention, who taps on it to see what's there. That button leads to an ad screen promoting more of the developer apps. This is unacceptable in a paid app for children.

Great app! You pay one time and you get the complete game(entire alphabet), no in-app purchases, no ads. Fun and educational. NOTE TO AVOKIDDO If you made one for numbers and math I would buy it! Please consider ;)

Good game. Would be nice to have a choice of narrator to go with us/uk spellings (I've never heard and way "apricot" like that before!) but understand that is much more costly to develop. The biggest issue is that kids can drag the letters in any order when spelling, I would prefer an option to force writing the word left-to-right (you know like we do everywhere else).
My 4 year old loves it! Lots of learning in a fun way!
My 3 yr old loves this app and has learned so much already!

I have a hard time finding good games for my 3 year old. This one was totally worth the money. Its enertaining and he learns letters and other skills by playing it. Its even fun to watch him play. Really digging avakiddo games

This is by far the best game I have found for my 3-1/2 year old son. He really likes to play it and it is helping him learn his letters.  I realize you can jump to any letter manually, but I think it would be good to have an option to either start the game on a random letter instead of "A" every time and/or move through the letters in random order.  Overall, excellent, high quality game and well worth the price.
replyContent: Hello Scott, thanks so much for your kind words and feedback! The app actually does support the random order. At the bottom of the panel where you select the letters, there are two pink round buttons. Click on the "random" button and from now on you will move through the letters in random order. I hope this helps. Thanks again!

content: We have this game on both tablets and its the kids favourite game, my only wish was they they did it with english spelljngs rather than American, oh and maybe that you could choose lower case letters.
replyContent: We are so glad to hear that ABC Ride is your kids' favourite game! Please note that in the parents section there is an option for English spelling and another for lower case letters. Thanks for your feedback! :-)

content: 3 year old is enjoying learning about letters with this game. Lovely graphics too.
The best game to learn letters
My three year old love this game. Beautifully designed. One of the best games for toddlers! Waiting for more from the developer.
